title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The mantel-piece of one of the rooms is surmounted with an earl's coronet, and the letters W. E. T. wreathed together, signifying "Walter Earl of Tarras," a title which, in 1660, was conferred for life upon Walter Scott of Highchester, the husband of Mary Countess of Buccleuch.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: TheEarls of Glencairn, Crawford, Dundonald, and Tarras, with several other persons of consideration, encouraged the rising of thc Presbyterians, who, hastilyassuming arms, appeared in different parts of thecounlry, in open opposition to the government.
